WhatIs.Content: Health Daily Link (HDL) is a comprehensive web app designed to help individuals track their health-related activities and stay consistent with their wellness goals. From daily routines like diet and hydration to broader metrics like sleep and weight tracking, HDL makes it simple to log, monitor, and analyze your progress.
WhatIs.Title: What is Health Daily Link

Dashboard.Desc: The weekly summary of your tracked data, including diet consumption VS schedule, water consumption, sport sessions, sleep cycles, and medicine consumption.
Dashboard.Title: Dashboard

Manual.DietConsumptionDesc: Record actual consumption of foods and beverages, compare it with scheduled meal contents. Records are shown in a weekly-based view calendar.
Manual.DietConsumptionHowItWorks1: Pick a scheduled meal to auto-fill the supposed-to-consume elements.
Manual.DietConsumptionHowItWorks2: Add optional notes for the entire meal or individual elements.
Manual.DietConsumptionHowItWorks3: Ensure exact spelling and formatting of element names for accurate comparison.
Manual.DietConsumptionHowItWorks4: Scheduled meals data must be filled beforehand.
Manual.DietConsumptionInputs3: Consumed Elements (name, quantity, measurement unit, element optional note)
Manual.DietScheduleDesc: To define your diet plan with all details, including meals time and meal elements by quantity.
Manual.DietScheduleHowItWorks1: Upon adopting a new schedule, create a new schedule record with inputs of schedule order (1st, 2nd, ...etc) and schedule start date @ 'Schedule' service.
Manual.DietScheduleHowItWorks2: Then in 'Schedule Meals' service, define the meals scheduled within the new schedule record you just created, specifying their names and supposed-to-consume times of the day.
Manual.DietScheduleHowItWorks3: Last step is in 'Meal Elements' service, where you need to insert the elements to consume within the meal, listing their names, quantities, quantity measurement units, and element alternatives -if any is allowed-.
Manual.DietScheduleHowItWorks4: Those records are the ones to be used for easy input process @ 'Diet Consumption' service, and they are to be engaged in commitment analysis & comparison between what's supposed to consume VS actually consumed. So for comparison sake, upon any modifications for the schedule, it's recommended to build a new schedule from bottom up, instead of updating existing one.
Manual.LabTestsDesc: Store results of blood tests with optional inputs based on the tests conducted.
Manual.LabTestsInputs2: Test Indicators (e.g., HDL fats, LDL fats, etc...)
Manual.MedicineConsumptionDesc: Track medication intakes based on predefined schedules and view data in a monthly calendar.
Manual.MedicineScheduleDesc: Define medication schedule with detailed consumption instructions.
Manual.SleepCyclesDesc: Track your daily sleep patterns and view records in a monthly calendar.
Manual.SportSessionsDesc: Monitor your physical sport activities and view the records in a monthly calendar.
Manual.WateringDesc: Track your water consumption to ensure you meet the minimum consumption level required.
Manual.WeightReadingsDesc: Record weekly weight readings, including detailed measurements specific to the InBody 120 scale.

WeightReadings.Total Number of WeightReadings (Nutritio: Total Number of Weight Readings (Nutritionist Weekly Visits)
